title: Inside the church with a hot tub and games room you can book for holidays
text:

Britain is filled with quirky holiday rentals from a double decker bus to a 1920s train station, and now you can add a 19th century stone church to the list.

St Curig's Church in Snowdonia isn't your traditional church; here you'll find the likes of an outdoor hot tub, games room complete with a snooker table, and a cosy living room with a roaring log fire.

However it has retained some of its original features including a breathtaking 19th Century mosaic ceiling and some of its stained glass windows.

Meanwhile, the Pulpit Room still features the original stone pulpit, but instead of pews next to it you'll find a large hand-carved oak four-poster bed instead.

The church can sleep up to 16 people boasting four ensuite bedrooms, as well as twin rooms and a bunk room with four beds.

(Image: Independent Cottages)

The property also offers a fully equipped kitchen with a large dining area, and a cosy living room with comfortable sofas, a TV and plenty of board games and books if you fancy a quiet night in (or the British weather lets you down and you don't fancy a walk).

Tucked away in one of the church's large alcoves, you'll also find a piano and a harp if you are feeling musically inclined.

Thanks to the high ceilings, wooden decor and the stone walls and flooring, it's easy to feel like you've stepped on to a film set from the moment you walk through the door.

(Image: Independent Cottages)

The good news is that while it might feel like you're in the 19th century, you'll have all the modern comforts you need while you stay - the church has features like hot water and heating.

It can make for quite a memorable stay especially if you're looking to explore Snowdonia Park.

For a start, the church boasts a handy location right by the village of Capel Curig where you'll find cosy pubs and restaurants, while the property looks out to the spectacular Carneddau Mountains and is right by heaps of walking trails.

(Image: Independent Cottages)

That includes Swallow Falls (apparently best seen after heavy rainfall), as well as Betws-y-Coed and plenty of lakes including Llyn Parc, Llyn Geirionydd, Llyn Crafnant and Llyn Elsi.

It's also close to highlights including Mount Snowdon itself, as well as the Marin Trail and Penmachno Mountain Bike Trails sure to be a hit with cyclists.

(Image: Independent Cottages)

Travelling with the kids? Go Below is nearby with underground caving adventures, while zip wire Velocity is a short car ride away, as well as Snowdonia's new Surf Snowdonia attraction.

Want to check it out for yourself? Prices start from £3,990 for seven nights on Independent Cottages - that's approximately £249pp if you fill the property with 16 people.
description: The church in Snowdonia can sleep up to 16 people and boasts a games room, hot tub and some eye-catching interiors
